//ABOUT ACTIVITY About the application The app is mean to save private data like usernames, passwords, PIN numbers and other sensitive informations on a NFC tag.

You can take a standard NFC tag like the NXP-NTAG213 and use the tag to save your passwords on your desk. Only you can read the data on the tag. You can stick a tag to your wallet and save your PIN numbers and other info on it. If the wallet gets stolen, nobody but you can read the encoded data on the tag.
Development Hello, I made this app because I wanted to store my password safely on my desk. But primarily because I ordered 100+ NFC tags and I had no idea what to do with them. If you like the app you can buy me a coffee or not.
//SETTINGS ACTIVITY Cipher algorithm Encryption algorithm Selected algorithm type
Cipher algorithm info This algorithm encodes your message with a cipher algorithm. 
 The encoded message is the same size as the original, so you can store a longer message on the NFC tag. 
 
 The message can be deciphered with any device that uses this app, you only need to know the password. You can use the same password on multiple NFC tags. 
 You can encode ASCII values from 32-126. If you use a character that is outside this range lets say a new line (ASCII value 10) it will encode a random value instead. 
 
 The algorithm is not nearly as safe as the encryption type, but it gets the job done.
Encryption algorithm info This algorithm will encrypt your message with a very strong AES algorithm. 
 The encrypted message will be approximately 3x the size of the original one. 
 
 The message can only be read with the same mobile device it was created with and a unique password. 
 
 If you use the same password twice for two different NFC tags, you will not be able to decrypt the the message that was encoded with the same password first. Also, if you delete tha app you will not be able to decode the messages. 
 
 There is no chance that someone could crack this encoded message. In fact there is a big chance that at some point even you will not be able to decode it, if you are not careful.
